name: CyclingButtonWidgetHelper
description: The `CyclingButtonWidgetHelper` class is a JSMacros helper for cycling button widgets that allows users to cycle through predefined values when clicked. This widget is perfect for settings toggles, option selections, and any UI element where users need to choose from a discrete set of options. Cycling buttons automatically advance through their values each time they're clicked and display the current value as text.
overview:
The `CyclingButtonWidgetHelper` provides a user-friendly way to create buttons that cycle through a sequence of values. Each click advances to the next value in the sequence, wrapping around when reaching the end. This makes it ideal for:

- **Settings toggles** (On/Off, True/False, etc.)
- **Mode selection** (Easy/Medium/Hard, Day/Night, etc.)
- **Option cycling** (Red/Green/Blue, Small/Medium/Large, etc.)
- **Configuration interfaces** where users need to select from predefined options

**Key Features:**
- Automatic value cycling with wrap-around
- Customizable value-to-text conversion for display
- Support for default and alternate value sets
- Optional prefix text for labels
- Builder pattern for easy configuration
- Action callbacks on value changes
- Chainable method calls for fluent API

methods.name: getValue
methods.description: Retrieves the current value selected in the cycling button.
examples:
const currentValue = modeButton.getValue();
Chat.log("Current difficulty: " + currentValue);

methods.name: getStringValue
methods.description: Returns the current value as it would be displayed on the button, using the value-to-text conversion function.
examples:
const displayText = modeButton.getStringValue();
Chat.log("Button displays: " + displayText);

methods.name: setValue
methods.description: Sets the cycling button to a specific value. The value must be one of the configured values.

methods.name: cycle
methods.description: Cycles the button by the specified amount of steps. Positive values move forward through the values, negative values move backward.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Number of steps to cycle (positive for forward, negative for backward)

methods.name: forward
methods.description: Cycles the button forward by one step (equivalent to `cycle(1)`).

methods.name: backward
methods.description: Cycles the button backward by one step (equivalent to `cycle(-1)`).

methods.name: getX
methods.description: Gets the x coordinate

methods.name: getY
methods.description: Gets the y coordinate

methods.name: setPos
methods.description: Sets the position

methods.name: getWidth
methods.description: Gets the width

methods.name: getHeight
methods.description: Gets the height

methods.name: setWidth
methods.description: Sets the width

methods.name: setLabel
methods.description: Sets the button label (deprecated)

methods.name: setLabel
methods.description: Sets the button label

methods.name: getLabel
methods.description: Gets the current label

methods.name: setAlpha
methods.description: Sets transparency

methods.name: getActive
methods.description: Gets whether the button is clickable

methods.name: setActive
methods.description: Sets whether the button is clickable

methods.name: setVisible
methods.description: Sets whether the button is visible

methods.name: click
methods.description: Programmatically clicks the button

methods.name: click
methods.description: Clicks with optional waiting

methods.name: setTooltip
methods.description: Sets tooltip text

name: CyclicButtonBuilder
description: The `CyclicButtonBuilder` class is a fluent builder for creating cycling button widgets that allow users to cycle through predefined values with each click. This builder provides a comprehensive API for configuring all aspects of cycling buttons including value sets, display formatting, behavior customization, and event handling. It's designed to create intuitive UI elements for settings toggles, mode selections, and any interface requiring discrete value selection.
overview:
The `CyclicButtonBuilder` class offers a powerful and flexible way to create cycling buttons with:

- **Value Management**: Support for default and alternative value sets with automatic cycling
- **Custom Display Formatting**: Configurable value-to-text conversion for rich text display
- **Behavior Control**: Toggle functions for conditional value sets and custom actions
- **Visual Customization**: Optional prefix text and display formatting options
- **Event Handling**: Action callbacks for responding to value changes
- **Builder Pattern**: Fluent API with method chaining for easy configuration

This builder is particularly useful for creating settings interfaces, mode selectors, and any UI component where users need to choose from a predefined set of options.

constructors.description: Creates a new CyclicButtonBuilder with the specified screen and value-to-text conversion function.

parameters.name: screen
parameters.description: The screen to add the button to

parameters.name: valueToText
parameters.description: Function to convert values to display text

methods.name: initially
methods.description: Sets the initial value for the cycling button.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The initial value for the button

methods.name: values
methods.description: Sets the default values that the button will cycle through.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: Variable number of values to cycle through

methods.name: alternatives
methods.description: Sets alternative values that the button will cycle through when the alternate toggle condition is true.

methods.name: values
methods.description: Sets both default and alternative value arrays.

methods.name: values
methods.description: Sets both default and alternative value lists.

methods.name: option
methods.description: Sets a prefix text that appears before the button value, separated by a colon.

methods.name: option
methods.description: Sets a prefix text using a TextHelper object.

methods.name: omitTextOption
methods.description: Controls whether the prefix option text should be displayed or omitted.

parameters.name: optionTextOmitted
parameters.description: Whether to omit the prefix text

examples: builder.omitTextOption(true); // Only show the value, no prefix

methods.name: action
methods.description: Sets the action to run when the button is clicked.

methods.name: valueToText
methods.description: Sets a custom function to convert button values to display text.

parameters.name: valueToText
parameters.description: Function to convert values to text

methods.name: alternateToggle
methods.description: Sets a function to determine whether the button should use alternative values.

methods.name: createWidget
methods.description: Creates the cycling button widget with all configured settings.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Creates the cycling button and adds it to the screen (alias for createWidget).

methods.name: pos
methods.description: Sets the position

methods.name: x
methods.description: Sets the x coordinate

methods.name: y
methods.description: Sets the y coordinate

methods.name: size
methods.description: Sets the dimensions

methods.name: width
methods.description: Sets the width

methods.name: height
methods.description: Sets the height

methods.name: alpha
methods.description: Sets transparency

methods.name: visible
methods.description: Sets visibility

methods.name: active
methods.description: Sets whether the widget is interactive

methods.name: zIndex
methods.description: Sets the rendering order
